query: How do the properties of SNe II-L and SNe IIn extend our understanding of supernovae and compare to other types of supernovae?

citation_function_classification.justification: The query asks how the properties of SNe II-L and SNe IIn broaden (extend) our understanding of supernovae and how they compare with other supernova types.
